place.name: WICK
place.gazetteerText: WICK, a parish in Bridgend district, Glamorgan; on the coast, 5½ miles SW of Cowbridge r. station. Post town, Bridgend. Acres, 1,370; of which 50 are water. Real property, £1,309. Pop., 423. Houses, 88. The property is much subdivided. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to St. Brides-Major. The church is decayed. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
